summary: This bill, the "Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program Enhancement Act," directs the Secretary of Agriculture to commission a review of the Cattle Fever Tick Eradication Program. The Secretary must contract with a land-grant college or similar agricultural institution to evaluate the program's effectiveness, its funding, its treatment protocols, and the benefits and burdens it places on cattle producers. Based on this review, the Secretary must submit a report to Congress with the findings and recommendations for improving the program, including how to reduce the compliance burden on producers.
